challengeInfo.title: 30 Days React Hands-On Challenge
challengeInfo.shortDescription: A practical 30-day coding challenge to master React step-by-step.
challengeInfo.fullDescription: This 30-day React hands-on challenge is designed to help developers build core React skills by building one small project each day. From beginner-friendly tasks like form validation to advanced topics like drag-and-drop and API integration, each day targets a key concept. By the end of the challenge, you'll have 30 mini React projects and a stronger understanding of real-world application building.

days.title: JSX & Rendering
days.shortDescription: Practice JSX and rendering elements.
days.longDescription: Understand JSX syntax and render static elements on the screen. Create a simple functional component and return some HTML elements.

days.title: React Props
days.shortDescription: Pass props to components.
days.longDescription: Create parent and child components. Pass data using props and display them inside the child component.

days.title: React useState
days.shortDescription: Use state to manage dynamic data.
days.longDescription: Learn the `useState` hook to manage state inside a component. Build a simple counter or toggler to practice.

days.title: Conditional Rendering
days.shortDescription: Show or hide UI based on state.
days.longDescription: Use conditional rendering with `if`, ternary operators, or logical &&. Build a simple login/logout toggle.

days.title: Event Handling
days.shortDescription: Handle click and input events.
days.longDescription: Learn how to handle user interactions like button clicks and form inputs. Create functions that respond to these events.

days.title: Fetch & Display API Data
days.shortDescription: Use `useEffect` to call a public API.
days.longDescription: Use `fetch()` and `useEffect()` to load data from a public API (e.g., JSONPlaceholder) and display it in a list or card view. Handle loading and error states.

days.title: Form Handling
days.shortDescription: Handle controlled form inputs.
days.longDescription: Create a form with input fields and connect them to state using `useState`. Handle form submission and validation.

days.title: Component Communication
days.shortDescription: Lift state up and pass data/functions.
days.longDescription: Implement communication between sibling components using a common parent. Pass state and callbacks via props.

days.title: Basic Routing
days.shortDescription: Use `react-router-dom` for navigation.
days.longDescription: Install and use `react-router-dom` to create multiple pages. Set up `BrowserRouter`, `Routes`, and `Route` components.

days.title: 404 Page & Navigation
days.shortDescription: Add a NotFound route and nav links.
days.longDescription: Add a 404 Not Found route and create a basic navbar with `Link` or `NavLink`. Improve navigation UX.

days.title: List Rendering
days.shortDescription: Render lists using `.map()`.
days.longDescription: Take an array of data and display it dynamically using `map()`. Assign keys to items properly.

days.title: Conditional Rendering
days.shortDescription: Render elements conditionally.
days.longDescription: Use conditional statements like `&&`, `?:`, or ternary operators to render different elements based on state or props.

days.title: Forms & Inputs
days.shortDescription: Create a form with input fields.
days.longDescription: Build a form with controlled inputs and handle form submission. Validate inputs and update the component state.

days.title: Form Validation
days.shortDescription: Add validation to form fields.
days.longDescription: Use custom logic or libraries like Yup or Formik to validate form fields. Show error messages and disable submission if invalid.

days.title: React Fragments
days.shortDescription: Use React Fragments to group elements.
days.longDescription: Learn how to use `<React.Fragment>` or shorthand `<>` `</>` to return multiple elements without adding extra nodes to the DOM.

days.title: Styling in React
days.shortDescription: Style components using various methods.
days.longDescription: Explore inline styles, CSS Modules, and styled-components to apply styles to your React components.

days.title: useMemo Hook
days.shortDescription: Optimize performance with `useMemo`.
days.longDescription: Use `useMemo` to memoize expensive calculations and prevent unnecessary re-renders. Include a small demo with a slow function.

days.title: React Icons & Search Box
days.shortDescription: Add a search input with an icon.
days.longDescription: Create a search input and place an icon inside it using absolute positioning or input adornments.

days.title: Component Reusability
days.shortDescription: Make components reusable with props.
days.longDescription: Refactor your code to make components reusable by passing props dynamically. Demonstrate with Button or Card components.

days.title: React DevTools
days.shortDescription: Explore components using DevTools.
days.longDescription: Install React Developer Tools in your browser and use it to inspect React components, state, and props.

days.title: Controlled vs Uncontrolled Components
days.shortDescription: Understand the difference between controlled and uncontrolled components.
days.longDescription: Create an input form using both controlled and uncontrolled components. Explore how state is managed differently.

days.title: React Portals
days.shortDescription: Use React Portals to render components outside the DOM hierarchy.
days.longDescription: Create a modal or tooltip using React Portals. Understand how it helps with z-index and DOM placement issues.

days.title: React Performance Optimization
days.shortDescription: Optimize performance using memoization techniques.
days.longDescription: Learn how to use `React.memo`, `useMemo`, and `useCallback` to prevent unnecessary re-renders.

days.title: React Error Boundaries
days.shortDescription: Handle UI errors gracefully using Error Boundaries.
days.longDescription: Implement a class component to catch JavaScript errors in child components and display a fallback UI.

days.title: Building a Theme Toggle
days.shortDescription: Create a light/dark mode toggle for your app.
days.longDescription: Use React state and conditional classNames to build a reusable theme switcher component.

days.title: React Testing with RTL
days.shortDescription: Write tests using React Testing Library.
days.longDescription: Learn how to write unit and integration tests for your components using RTL and Jest.

days.title: Redux Basics
days.shortDescription: Manage global state using Redux.
days.longDescription: Set up Redux in a React project. Create actions, reducers, and use the store to manage global state.

days.title: Redux Thunk for Async
days.shortDescription: Use Redux Thunk middleware for async actions.
days.longDescription: Call an API using Redux Thunk, dispatch loading and success/error actions, and update the global store accordingly.

days.title: React Context API
days.shortDescription: Share data using the Context API.
days.longDescription: Use React Context to avoid prop drilling. Create a context provider for theme or auth and use it in child components.

days.title: Deploy React App
days.shortDescription: Deploy your React app to GitHub Pages or Vercel.
days.longDescription: Learn how to build and deploy your React project using GitHub Pages, Vercel, or Netlify. Configure routes and 404 pages.
